headline.main: MISS REID MARRIED TQPHILIPA.CQMRD; Head of U. S. Mission School in-Montevideo Becomes Bride of Commissioner of Friends

docs.snippet: Last week's foreign exchange market had proceeded evenly enough to show no great disturbance in undertone or rates when, unexpectedly on Wednesday, there began a drying up of the demand for sterling "forwards" carried right up to the close on Friday...
docs.lead_paragraph: Last week's foreign exchange market had proceeded evenly enough to show no great disturbance in undertone or rates when, unexpectedly on Wednesday, there began a drying up of the demand for sterling "forwards" carried right up to the close on Friday to effect the sharpest setback in that market in many months, in fact, since mid-August when sterling convertibility was suspended.

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Dec. 10 -- Eric Wyndham-White, Executive Secretary of the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment, revealed in a news conference today that some 800 amendments had been submitted to the Charter drafted by the eighteen-nation...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Dec. 10 -- Eric Wyndham-White, Executive Secretary of the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment, revealed in a news conference today that some 800 amendments had been submitted to the Charter drafted by the eighteen-nation Preparatory Committee in Geneva.
docs.abstract: Conf with Dr Molinari on ITO Havana conf

headline.main: AMENDMENTS CRAM HAVANA ITO HOPPER; 800 Time-Consuming Bills May Jeopardize Emergence of World Trade Umpire

byline.original: By RUSSELL PORTERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Dec. 11 -- Steps were taken today to speed up the work of the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment to prevent its materially running beyond the scheduled Jan. 15 deadline or of being compelled to recess because of the heavy load...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Dec. 11 -- Steps were taken today to speed up the work of the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment to prevent its materially running beyond the scheduled Jan. 15 deadline or of being compelled to recess because of the heavy load of amendments to the Geneva draft charter of the proposed International Trade Organization.
docs.abstract: efforts to expedite conf discussed; undeveloped countries attack Article 17 on tariffs easing and preferences end; disputes revd

headline.main: ITO PARLEY BEGINS TO SPEED UP WORK; Trade Conference in Havana Acts to Prevent Long Stay Beyond Jan. 15 or Recess

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Dec. 12 -- William L. Clayton, chairman of the United States delegation to the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment, today received a report from Clair Wilcox, vice chairman, on the impasse that threatens the proposed...
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Dec. 12 -- William L. Clayton, chairman of the United States delegation to the United Nations Conference on Trade and Employment, today received a report from Clair Wilcox, vice chairman, on the impasse that threatens the proposed International Trade Organization.
docs.abstract: C Wilcox gives Clayton rept on amendments aimed at keeping trade barriers; Clayton to seek amendment withdrawals by certain delegations; US stand against weakened charter discussed; certain amendments cited; Argentine delegation again scores Article 17

docs.snippet: Week Ended Dec. 12, 1947. It was an unsettled and uncertain week in the foreign exchange market. While special incidents explained away the irregularity of the Canadian free dollar, it is to be expected that as the year draws to its close adjustment...
docs.lead_paragraph: Week Ended Dec. 12, 1947. It was an unsettled and uncertain week in the foreign exchange market. While special incidents explained away the irregularity of the Canadian free dollar, it is to be expected that as the year draws to its close adjustment of accounts by commercial and fiscal institutions will produce an ebb and flow in values.

docs.snippet: HAVANA, Dec. 16 -- Dr. Diego Luis Molinari, chairman of the Argentine delegation here, said in a press conference tonight that Argentina was prepared to grant $5,000,000,000 in "graduated and compensated credits" to needy nations.
docs.lead_paragraph: HAVANA, Dec. 16 -- Dr. Diego Luis Molinari, chairman of the Argentine delegation here, said in a press conference tonight that Argentina was prepared to grant $5,000,000,000 in "graduated and compensated credits" to needy nations.
docs.abstract: Dr D L Mulinari says nation is ready to loan $5 billion to needy nations
